findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: Unsanitized user input used in SQL query
findings.code: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '{username}'"
findings.evidence: query = f"SELECT * FROM users WHERE username = '{username}'"
findings.fix_suggestion: Use parameterized queries with SQLAlchemy or similar ORM

findings.title: Command Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: Unsanitized user input used in command execution
findings.fix_suggestion: Use subprocess module with shell=False and validate user input

findings.title: Hardcoded Credentials
findings.description: Hardcoded database credentials in source code
findings.fix_suggestion: Store secrets in environment variables or a secure vault

findings.title: Dangerous use of eval()
findings.description: Use of eval() with user-supplied input
findings.fix_suggestion: Avoid using eval() with user input. Use safer alternatives.

findings.title: Command Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: Unsanitized user input used in command execution
findings.fix_suggestion: Validate and sanitize user input before using in command execution

findings.title: Hardcoded Credentials
findings.description: Hardcoded API key and password in source code
findings.fix_suggestion: Store secrets in environment variables or a secure vault

findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: Unsanitized user input used in SQL query
findings.code: String sql = "SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = " + id;

findings.title: SQL Injection Vulnerability
findings.description: Unsanitized user input used in SQL query
findings.code: query := fmt.Sprintf("SELECT * FROM users WHERE id = %s", id)
findings.remediation: Use parameterized queries with prepared statements
